    • Method Detail

      • markDirty

        void markDirty()
        Marks the visible region of the surface as dirty.

      • markDirty

        void markDirty​(Envelope region,
               boolean streaming)
        Marks the specified region of the surface as dirty. If the region is not part of the visible surface, it will be marked as invalid, but may not be updated until it becomes visible.
        Parameters:
        region - The dirty regoin
        streaming - If true, instructs the render to attempt to refresh the region at frame rates.

        java.util.Collection<Envelope> getSurfaceBounds()

        May only be invoked on GL thread.

        Returns:

      • setMinimumRefreshInterval

        void setMinimumRefreshInterval​(long millis)
        Sets the minimum refresh interval for the surface, in milliseconds. The visible tiles on the surface will be refreshed if the specified amount of time has elapsed since the last update, whether or not they have been marked dirty.
        Parameters:
        millis - The minimum refresh interval, in milliseconds. If less-then-or-equal to 0, the refresh interval is disabled.

      • getMinimumRefreshInterval

        long getMinimumRefreshInterval()
